title: Java 17:  No converter available issue
body:
### Describe the bug

Trying to get my Quarkus project running on Java 17, but get the following error on a couple of my tests.

The following issue happens _after_ the test and `@after` have completed. Looks like objects are getting copied and hitting a snag on one of the libraries I am using.

If this turns not to be a Quarkus issue, that's fine, but will need to know what the core issue is so I can collaborate with the guys at Indriya so they can fix this for them.

```
No converter available
---- Debugging information ----
message             : No converter available
type                : tech.units.indriya.function.RationalNumber
converter           : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter
message[1]          : Unable to make field private static final long java.lang.Number.serialVersionUID accessible: module java.base does not "opens java.lang" to unnamed module @1c0dc10
-------------------------------
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/Epic-Breakfast-Productions/OpenQuarterMaster.git

`dev-28-feature-request-java-17` branch

`./gradlew test`

Can try to make a smaller reproducer on request

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)
